modules.title: Faith Christian Academy at a glance

seo.title: About FCA | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Learn about Faith Christian Academy of Plant City, our mission, and our commitment to Christ-centered education.

modules.title: About Faith Christian Academy
modules.subtitle: A Christ-centered school serving families in Plant City with excellence.

modules.body:
Community
We love our community. Our passion is to make Plant City and surrounding areas a place where families can have a great educational experience with quality programming, inclusion in community events, and a sense of belonging. Between our efforts in participating in the local parades, local festivals, involvement with Kiwanis, choir and sports activities at local venues, FCA immerses our school in our community to allow all students a place to fit in.

Christianity
Faith Christian Academy believes in being totally Christian. From the moment you arrive on campus you will experience the love of Christ. Our passion for teaching and ministering to our students provides an outlet for students to embrace their distinctive Christian beliefs and exhibit true discipleship of Christ.

Academics
Our strong academic programming allows for all students to learn. Whether seeking dual enrollment with a local college or needing additional classroom support, we are here with you all the way. Our unique ability to help every student excel is why we offer strong accredited accomplishments in education.

Athletics
Falcon Pride - that is what we have in our school. We offer full programming for sports and for athletes of all kinds. Starting in kindergarten with Cross Country all the way to Football, FCA offers several sports for your child to be involved in.

seo.title: Admissions | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Explore admissions, tuition, tours, and summer enrichment at Faith Christian Academy of Plant City.

modules.title: Admissions
modules.subtitle: Come see our campuses and discover the FCA difference.

modules.body:
Let's Get Started.
Our enrollment process at FCA is designed to ensure a smooth and personalized experience for every family. To get started, book a tour with our Enrollment Specialist, Ms. Nylah, to explore our campus and learn more about our programs. Next, schedule a financial advising meeting with Ms. Nia to discuss tuition and payment options. Once you are ready, complete the online application and submit the required documents along with a $200 registration fee. Students may also need to complete standardized testing for placement. Once all steps are completed, your child will officially become an FCA Falcon.

seo.title: Admissions FAQ | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Get answers to common admissions questions at Faith Christian Academy of Plant City.

modules.title: Admissions FAQ
modules.subtitle: Answers to common questions from FCA families.

items.question: What curriculum is used to teach reading in the lower grades?
items.answer: We utilize Abeka and Deep Roots curriculum in K through 5th grade. We utilize Abeka, BJU, Purposeful Design and Cengage curriculum in 6th through 12th grade.

items.question: Do you have an extended care? What are extended care hours?
items.answer: Faith Christian Academy offers extended care for all ages. Hours are from 7:00 AM until school begins in the mornings and from the release of students from classes until 6:00 PM in the afternoons.

items.question: What special classes are available for elementary students?
items.answer: In addition to the normal academic classes, FCA provides opportunity for children in grades Kindergarten through 12th grade to participate in music classes, physical education, computer v1.1 classes, art, library and Spanish.

items.question: Describe the spiritual life of the school.
items.answer: The Christian in Faith Christian Academy is key to the mission of the school. FCA is committed to providing a Christian atmosphere for the total growth of the individual student. Each student attends Bible classes daily and chapel services weekly, designed to apply the truth of Christ's message to daily challenges. Faculty and staff are committed Christians partnering with parents in student formation.

items.question: What are the demographics of the school population?
items.answer: Faith Christian Academy embraces the diversity of the community in which it is situated. The school does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national and ethnic origin in the administration of its educational policies, admission policies, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs.

items.question: What are the qualifications of the teachers?
items.answer: All full time teachers must have earned a bachelors degree from an accredited college or university and be certified by the State of Florida or by FCA's accrediting agency, the Association of Christian Schools International. All teachers must be born again Christians and demonstrate a vibrant relationship with God.

items.question: What are the school hours?
items.answer: Classes begin at 8:00 AM. Lower Level (K through 5th Grade) release at 2:55 PM. Upper Level (6th through 12th Grade) release at 3:00 PM. After school care is available from 3:15 PM until 6:00 PM. Offices are open from 7:30 AM until 4:00 PM.

items.question: Please describe the school lunch program.
items.answer: FCA provides items for purchase for lunch for students in grades K through 12th. The school contracts with an outside company to supply items that meet state guidelines. A product price list is posted in the lunchroom area and flyer in the main office.

items.question: What is the student/teacher ratio in the various grades?
items.answer: For K through 5th students, the maximum ratio is 1 teacher for every 18 students. For 6th through 8th students, the maximum ratio is 1 teacher for every 22 students. For 9th through 12th students, the maximum ratio is 1 teacher for every 25 students.

items.question: How does your school rank with other schools in the area?
items.answer: FCA compares favorably with any school in the Southeast Hillsborough County area. Faith students, on average, test one to two grade levels above their contemporaries in public school, and achievement tests indicate FCA students score better than 70% of students in other private Christian schools.

items.question: Is there a dress code?
items.answer: FCA is a uniform school. All students are required to purchase and wear a uniform each day. Uniforms enhance the environment by creating an atmosphere of learning and professionalism and increase campus security by allowing faculty and staff to instantly recognize those who are not enrolled in school.

seo.description: Explore summer enrichment opportunities for FCA students.

modules.title: Summer Enrichment Camp
modules.subtitle: Keep learning strong all summer at FCA.

modules.body:
Summer Enrichment Camp from June 2 - July 18, 2025
Parents Asked - FCA Delivered
8:30 a.m. - 6 p.m.
Registration $50 / Summer Tuition $450
1st Payment Due: June 2nd, 2025
2nd Payment Due: July 1st, 2025

modules.title: Summer Enrichment Application 2025
modules.body: Apply for the FCA Summer Enrichment Camp.

We are excited to offer bus transportation for the 2025 Summer Camp at Faith Christian Academy. This is a convenient and safe option for families in Plant City who need reliable transportation for their child to and from camp each day.

Transportation Details:
Cost: $250 for the entire summer
Service Dates: June 9 - July 18, 2025
Pickup/Drop-Off: Your child will be picked up no earlier than 7am and dropped off no later than 5pm directly at your home

Bus transportation will start on June 9th, 2025. Seats are limited and will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis.

modules.title: Summer camp transportation
modules.body: Reserve your transportation spot.

We believe in being an asset to our community. FCA Summer Enrichment is open to children rising grades K-8 from our school and the surrounding Plant City area. We offer field trips, t-shirts, meals and snacks, daily included in the price. So why not enroll?

seo.title: Academics | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Faith Christian Academy offers rigorous academics rooted in Christian values.

modules.title: Academics
modules.subtitle: We deliver quality education grounded in faith.

modules.body:
Classrooms using the Abeka materials and methods are well-organized, highly efficient, interesting, and challenging classrooms. Their purpose is not socialization, self-awareness, self-gratification, democratization, or adjustment to environment. Their purpose is to educate students in the Bible, language, subject matter, and character.

The teachers do not teach character in an abstract, separate way. Rather, character is taught through consistent discipline; the teaching of traditional subject matter; reading from the great literature of the world; teaching the great characters of history that are worth emulating; and teaching traditional math, grammar, etc., in a disciplined, traditional way. Character training is seen as training children to do right because it is right to do right, not as encouraging children to concentrate on their feelings, needs, conflicts, and attitudes. Right character training leads a child to forget himself, not to concentrate on himself.

The students do not determine the curriculum, the pacing, the discipline, or the methods. These decisions are made by the teacher, who is a confident, well-trained, eager, willing servant of the Lord, working on the premise that a job worth doing is worth doing well and that in the education of children as well as in all of life, time is to be redeemed and every minute counts. Teachers using Abeka materials and methods are in control of the situation. They know that they are the teachers and that the students are the learners. They know what students need to learn, and they do not hesitate to teach facts and drill facts in order that the facts may be remembered. They do not accept the existential philosophy that we cannot know anything for sure and that there is no real meaning to life and that thus each individual must make his own meaning in his own way. If classroom teachers accept this philosophy, they would have no confidence in drilling facts and no basis for their claim to authority as teachers.

seo.title: Student Life | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Discover student life, community, and character development at FCA.

modules.title: Student Life
modules.subtitle: Faith, community, and leadership opportunities for every student.

modules.body: At Faith Christian Academy, student life is enriched through various programs and resources designed to support a well-rounded school experience. Our uniform policy ensures a sense of unity and professionalism among students, with all necessary details available through our uniform provider. The School Spirit Store allows students and families to show their FCA pride with branded apparel and accessories. Leadership opportunities abound with our Student Council, where students can actively participate in school events and decision-making. To help families stay organized, we provide a Student Calendar and a School Calendar, outlining important dates, events, and academic schedules throughout the year. Additionally, our School Supply List ensures that students are fully prepared for success in the classroom by providing a comprehensive list of required materials. Don't forget our PTO as well; there are so many family fun events taking place all school year. These elements of student life contribute to a vibrant and engaging school experience for all FCA students.

cards.title: 25-26 Student Calendar
cards.description: View the student calendar for the school year.

cards.description: Shop FCA branded apparel and accessories.

seo.title: Athletics | Faith Christian Academy of Plant City
seo.description: Falcons athletics build teamwork, discipline, and resilience.

modules.title: Athletics
modules.subtitle: Falcons athletics build teamwork, discipline, and resilience.

modules.body:
FCA Falcons Athletics Programs
Cross Country (Grades K-12, Male, Female)
Volleyball (Grades 3-12, Female)
Flag Football (Grades 3-12, Male, Female, Co-ed)
Soccer (Grades 3-12, Male, Female, Co-ed)
Basketball (Grades 3-12, Male, Female, Co-ed)
Bowling (Grades 7-12, Male, Female, Co-ed)
Cheer-leading (Grades 3-12, Female)

In order to cater to the athletic needs of our student body while participating in a Christ-centered sport environment, FCA is a member of the following leagues:
MFAC (Grades 7-12): All FCA Varsity sports compete in the Mid-Florida Athletic Conference (CFAC) and follow MFAC rules and regulations.
TBCAL (K-8): FCA participates in the Tampa Bay Christian Athletic League, offering competition for elementary and middle school teams including Cross Country for K-2nd graders. FCA Athletics adheres to respective league governing rules.

All athletes must maintain a 2.0 grade point average with no F's in any core subject to be eligible for participation. Athletics forms are required for all student-athletes.
